Key Match Events: The Cavaliers improved to 13-0, becoming the sixth team in NBA history to open a season in such brisk fashion.
Donovan Mitchell poured in 11 of his 23 points with three minutes left, helping the Cavaliers secure a 114-106 win over the Sixers.
Pre-Game Insights: Coach Nick Nurse indicated that Jared McCain's performance makes him a possibility for a full-time starter at some point.
Post-Match Reflections: The Sixers fell to 2-9, but coach Nick Nurse expressed encouragement about McCain's ability to share the ball and play the game the right way.
Veteran forward Caleb Martin said he sees progress in the team's performance and is looking at progress as a key aspect to move forward.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Sixers were without Joel Embiid, Paul George, and Tyrese Maxey due to varying degrees of physical distress, while Andre Drummond sat out with an illness.
Jared McCain had his third straight game of 20 points or more, and also showed his ability to share the ball.
The Cavaliers played a box-and-one defense on McCain at one point during the game.
Others: The article mentions historical examples of teams making the playoffs after starting with a poor record, including the 1977-78 Seattle SuperSonics, the 2021-22 Celtics, the 2021-22 Pelicans, and the 1996-97 Suns.
